intro: Elaphoglossum croatii, commonly known as the Croatian holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically leathery in texture. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its fertile fronds, which are clustered in strobila. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forests. Elaphoglossum croatii is native to regions of Europe and Asia, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
